text: Pours a slightly hazy straw color. Little head but some lacing. Pine aroma. Pine. Citrus. Maybe some mango.

Bottle shared from one Chicago guy at BeerTemple Amsterdam,The Netherlands. 23.04.2017. Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head. Aroma grapefruit, pine, peach, orange, fresh grassy note. Taste so fresh, tangerine, grapefruit, pomenegrate, peach, pinch of pine and grassy on the back, smooth silky, full body, average to fizzy carbonation, long pine finish, Perfection!

22 oz bottle shared. Cloudy orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes. Tastes of floral notes, citrus, tropical fruit, hop oils, pine. Medium body with a dry finish. Phenomenal.

Super hazed medium dark yellow., looks like grapefruit juice. Heady, lacey. Toasty hoppy resiny aroma. Fruit with a nice floral complement. Juicey with some pine, maybe minty pine. Same in taste, juicy, candy, hoppy deliciousness. Cost too much, but is worth it, wish they had sixers of bottles.Living semi-local being an IA resident Im glad they are available and usually fresh, the turnover is big- best brewery in IA. I like that chaulky toasty componant they always have. Would like to visit.

Citrus aroma. Very hazy amber with a half-inch off-white head, receding fairly quickly, leaving some lacing. Smooth, creamy feel with a citrus/juice initial taste, leading quickly to welcome bittering in the middle, finish, and aftertaste with some pine/resin also there. This is probably my favorite TG beer so far! Just wonderful.

22 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange color and topped by a decent sized off white layer of foam that slowly settles to a thin film and leaves sudsy lacing all over the glass. The aroma is full of tropical and citrus fruit with notes of juicy orange, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, and mango to go with a toasted bread and caramel malt base with some underlying pine resin. The flavor follows and is just as juicy as the aroma shows with the orange, grapefruit, and tangerine most prominent to go with a touch of pine and a firm hop bitterness on the back end while the toasted bread malts smooth things out. Medium bodied, smooth, and incredibly easy to drink with moderate carbonation that leads to a juicy citrus and bitter sweet finish. Really tasty stuff that drinks more like a single ipa. Awesome beer and glad I got to try it.

Hazy yellow orange with white head. Intense aroma of various fruits. Very complex considering its a single hop variety. Citrus, tropical, fruity. Taste is juicy, fruity with lots of bitterness. Medium body.

Poured up at Ratebeer Best 2017 Beer Fest where it exhibits a clear gold body that supports a tall light tan head of foam. The aroma is pulsing with peach and tangelo, some grapefruit delicious inviting. The taste delivers smooth rich juicy tangelo and tangerine and then getting a little more peach and papaya like midway and into the finish. Wow! Solid.

Bottle from trade. Hazy golden yellow orange in color... Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, mango, tangerines... Creamy mouthfeel, lots of tropical fruit juice, citrus and tropical hops, kiwi, light grassy bitterness on finish... Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12/21/16. Shared by cbfobes - many thanks! This stuff is BALLS good. Orange pour with a nice khaki head. Awesome aroma - I fuggin love citra. Tropical fruit abound, loads of pineapple, some citrus. Great flavor, not too bitter, loads of fresh hop character, pineapple, citrus, tropical fruits. Delicious!
Super cloudy, pale gold. Hugely tropical and intense aroma and flavor. Fairly heavy, hop acid laden body. Light, sharp carbonation... Amazing.

From mobile notes; On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: pours golden color, hazy, with stable white foamy head with good lacing. Aroma-flavor: 
Pale ale malt backbone and munich), supported with intense hop notes, which takes on citruses, lime, grapefruits, pine, hint of grass, fruity esters of peaches?,. Hop bitterness is high, body is medium, texture almost creamy, carbonation is medium.

Very hazy light golden amber. Just amazing pink grapefruit just shines in the nose with modest alpha acid presence. Modestly bitter with decent crackery malt, but the pink grapefruit is totally shining. Light body. For 8.5% its just amazing. After a while its a bit warming but really really drinkable. I mean this sings on so many levels. Wow.
Fresh bomber. Pours bright hazy yellow. Hints of peach, citrus, grapefruit. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bitterness, extremely drinkable. Very awesome!
Pours, smells and looks like orange juice. Very similar to xhops gold. Hazy bright citrus, extremely well ballanced nice finish.
Big, Bold, Dank, Citrusy. King Sue is one of my favorite releases from this year. Packaging is on point, as it always is with TG. The 3 bottles I bought were definitely not enough. Need more!

From tap at Ratebeer Best festival, Santa Rosa. Unclear yellow golden color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, grass, pine grapefruit, tropical fruits. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Golden with a white head. Great fruity hops, tropical, a bit oniony. Dry, moderately bitter, very "green".
Sample at RateBeer Best. Hazy gold, white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, pine. Flavor is pineapple, peach, citrus, grapefruit, pine, quite dank. Bitter, hoppy finish. Excellent.
Bottle from the cheese shop. Aroma is grassy and pineappley and orangy. High carbonation. Bitterness is again grassy. Alcohol seems higher than 8.5 actually.

22oz bottle from Windsor Hy-Vee. Especially pungent grapefruit quality that really fills the room after the pour. Peaches, pears, apricots and white grape juice. Cloudy orange-yellow appearance reminiscent of apricot nectar, with one finger of pillowy canvas colored head. Nice spidery lacing as you work your way down the glass. Nicely balanced grapefruit tang and mild bitterness from the first sip, followed by biscuity beer malt, peach and apricot, with a moderately bitter finish. Light- to medium bodied, nicely balanced and conceals its ABV well with a mild bitter astringency. A really well-crafted and carefully balanced brew, almost worthy of the hype surrounding it. The alcohol does start to show itself somewhere around the half-bottle mark. Slightly more bitter and more boozy than pseudoSue for sure, it still retains a fantastic balance and provides a fine drinking experience. TGB knows what they are doing. Have to try and get my hands on the Citra Double Dry Hopped variant one of these days.

Sampled from 22-oz bomber and shared by BVery, pours a semi-hazy golden pale colored beer with a decent sized off-white head that slowly dissipates and leaves behind some excellent lacing. Aroma of pine, golden grain malt, a touch of tropical fruit and some wild field onion. Taste is medium bodied, flavors of heavy citrusy and spicy Citra, golden grain malt and a touch of vanilla. Finish is semi-sweet and tropical fruity at first. Followed by some lingering powdered bitterness.

Approximately 16 oz. from a 22 oz. bottle, consumed on 12-30-16. Great, strong, funky, citric aroma features scents of peach and grapefruit (the fruit, rind, and peel) as well as wet wood. Strong, dark aroma. Pours a dull, hazy brass with a large amount of beige head. A bit too much head, and the dull color does nothing for me. Light effervescence. Creamy, uneven head; that part is good. Good, thick lacing. Settles into a more pleasing, deep golden color. Cloudiness in final pour. Nice, funky, dank taste atop a fruit and vanilla-sweet base. Nice, dry, funky finish. Gym bag and armpit in aroma and flavor. A touch of piney toothpaste. A good Citra showcase. Quite tasty, bordering on delicious. Funky, dry aftertaste. Medium to full body. Soft in the palate. Perhaps a bit undercarbonated, unfortunately. Complex. A lot going on. Not as outstanding as its very high rankings (5th highest rated double IPA and 31st highest rated beer overall as of this writing) would imply, but a very good beer, nearing great, nonetheless.

Aroma: Piney, Mildly Citrusy...
Appearance: Mildly Hazy Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head, Great Lacing...
Taste: Piney, Mildly Soapy, Mild Citrus...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Bottle shared by Brian, thanks! Pours a hazy yellow gold with a white head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has light citrus and grass with a touch of pine and some grains backing. Flavor has a touch of onion with a good amount of citrus, light grains and grass supporting.
Bomber shared by Bvery, thanks! Light golden pour. Huge tropical citrus hop aroma. Taste follows, bitter up front, very well balanced. This is dynamite!
Bottle shared by me. Yellow gold pour with a white head. Citrus and onion aroma. Low malt, citrus hop taste. Great.

Three days since bottling date. Pours beautiful clean copper into a snifter. Aroma is a big burst of tropical and melon notes, big mango and pineapple with heavy dank undertones and a clean floral faintly on the edges. Flavor is exactly what I'd hoped from the nose; all tropical fruits in a nice melange and with those firm resiny dankness to back it up. Amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I cant imagine a better beer. This is so flavorful with citrus hops just exploding with each sip, appearance is perfect with a pillowy white head. Its like psuedo sue on steroids. Exquisite in every way, my desert island beer.
On draft at tavour tasting. Totally amazing and worth the hype. Nice pungent citrusy hops hit you in the face. Rounded out by grapefruit. A tad on the sweet side. Gotta taste this fresh.
Amber. Stank dank garlic and onion with catty pine, grapefruit, and mango. Juicy pine with mango and onion. Fruity pebbles.

22oz bottle poured at home. Bottle picked up at the brewery.

Amazing tropical aroma, extremely smooth and fantastic bitterness on the back.

Draft at the source. Hazy gold half-filled chalice because even after driving for hours to get a beer I dont want a full pour. Im a dork. White head, nice lacing, okay retention. Aroma: bright citrus, backdrop of weed. Moderately sweet, medium bitterness, big fruity hop presence. Medium body, oily texture, avg carb. Overall: delightful.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2016 Bottle from a trade. A little over a month old. Pours hazy yellow orange with a white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, citrus, crisp citra hops, pine, orange, apricot and some very weak malty notes in the back. Taste is hops forward with a nice tropical flavor. Orange, mango, pineapple, pine, loads of crisp citra with a juicy crushable mouthfeel. No hint of alcohol. A nice DIPA which is somewhat "oldschool" compared to all the new england beers but it still has some of that extreme fruity- and juiciness to it along with the more punchy hoppy and pine notes. I dig it! One of the best Dipas Ive had for sure!

22 ounce bottle from Badger Spirits in Beloit, WI, served 10 minutes out of the fridge in a 35-year-old Andeker fluted glass picked up recently at Goodwill for .59. Im sure youre glad you knew that. Anyway...it pours a pale, hazy champagne-bubbly gold (turns out this glass was appropriate for showing off) with a moderate to large bubbly head, slowly diminishing and leaving fine lacing...really immense citric aroma - bitter orange and grapefruit, light sourdough yeasty qualities, a hint of thyme, a touch of wood smoke; it grows quite a bit more interesting and complex with 5 minutes out of the bottle....on the tongue, moderately sweet and lightly bitter at the front, growing towards a fairly strong bitterness at the finish (though still leavened by a bit of sugar) with cookie dough- sourdough yeastiness apparent throughout, helping to give the body an amazing mix of supple softness and thick fruity-juicy-acidic esters, always within perfect balance - its just insanely drinkable, with barely a hint of the alcohol, and the most velvety-smooth mouthfeel, coupled with soft, lightly tingly carbonation, imaginable. The only thing I can think of thats at all problematic is that there is a bit of a burn coming in if you do more than sip slowly, and the alcohol does grow a bit with warmth. But this is pretty terrific stuff all in all and Im certainly glad I was able to snag a bottle (only one, sadly) locally.

Bomber bought in Madison, WI. Thanks, Patrick K. Pours cloudy golden into snifter. Short ring lasts after a one finger white head dies down. Not as much aroma as Pseudo Sue. Somewhat disappointed by that. Taste is not that complex. Just a lot of bitterness. Good beer but Im a little disappointed given the immense hype given to this one. I think I liked Pseudo better.

Fresh bomber. Pour is a murky apricot orange with a thick white head that leaves awesome lacing. Aroma is full of bright tropical fruit. Mango, pineapple, and papaya. Oranges and tangerines are here as well as lots of dank pine. Sweet caramel malt too. Taste is an explosion of tropical and citrus fruit. Mango, orange, passion fruit, grapefruit, papaya, pine resin and a caramel like sweetness. Super juicy with a semi dry finish that lingers for a long while. Outstanding beer.

For my 2600th rating! 650ml bottle from Discount in Waukesha shared with bananabi11. Golden orange pour. White head. Some spotty lacing. Aroma has - wow! Open the cap, great hops! Big fruit, citrus. Somewhat overlayered fruits. Thick and strong. Great nose! Taste is of thick overlayered citrus, sweet malts, so grapefruity. Plus pine, and some garlic. Big citra. Orange juice. Big Overlayered. Easy to see Pseudo Sue under this. Medium to full bodied. Some alcohol, the blend is very good. Finishes quite a bit more bitter than bittersweet. This is excellent! 17

Fresh bomber recently gifted, pours a nice golden orange yellow hue with slim white head..nose is really nice tangerine citrus bomb with underlying catty presence and some wintergreen..initial aroma was much more pungent but seems to fade just a notch..mouthfeel here is really enjoyable, like the citrus pop up front molded with the green character of the hops and the and engaging bitterness..hides the ABV well, very nice double ipa all around that I am glad to have been given the opportunity to try..it is worthy of the high praise..

Fresh Bomber. Pours a hazy orange with a head that has a slight yellow tint. Lots of lacing coats the glass after a few sips. Big citrus and ripe tropical fruit aromas, smells sweet and juicy. Wonderful flavor and mouthfeel. Juicy fruit, orange, citrus. A medium to medium+ bitterness balanced with a medium sweetness. Medium+ bodied, soft, and lightly creamy. Green hops linger in the moderately bitter finish. My new favorite midwestern dipa. Excellent.
Bomber shared with gary....absolutely fantastic brew...hoppy fruitty deliciousness...so smooth...no alcohol taste...great brew

Bottle. Pours a pale unclear orange with a soapy white head that fades to a wispy film and collar with some lacing. Aroma has noticeable bitterness with cat piss tropical notes fleshy papaya mango meatiness. Taste is pretty smooth. Bitter hop that show cat piss tropical fruit citrus meaty flesh and a light malt that balances it all out. Palate is medium smooth and slightly dry.
Bottle shared by portableparty! Hazy apricot pour, foamy head and an aroma of fresh pears. Flavor is also nice tropical fruit, slightly bitter hops and deceivingly smooth for the high ABV. Solid.

Bomber pours a murky golden/orange with a huge beige head. Skunky resinous tropical hop aroma, pine, cat pee, mango and passion fruit. Smooth palate, skunky onion and cat piss, dry pine bitterness, tropical and citrus, grapefruit, mango, passion fruit, papaya, touch of sweet caramel malt. Awesome!

Keg @ ABR 2016. Gold pour with a medium white head. Nose is very bright and engaging. Lots of tropical fruits - grapefruit meat, mango, pineapple. Sea grass. Just a bit of onion and piss. Flavor is very clean and pretty well balanced. Light pale malt. A touch of citrus zest. More pineapple. Not overly bitter. Easy drinking considering the ABV. Great DIPA.

Thanks Virby44 for the bottle! Poured into a wineglass showing moderately filtered orange with a thin finger of quickly dissipating clean white foam. 

The nose shows big notes of citric orange, pineapple, and light pine resin on a bed of light caramel malts. 

The palate is light bodied and fully carbonated. Immediately the flavors shown are impossibly juicy orange and apricot into a mid palate of the same juicy flavors of pineapple, followed by light flavors of pine resin, finished with a light to moderate bitterness that is barely noticeable in light of all these flavors. Wow, this is easily one of the best IIPAs Ive ever had.

Bottle, 65cl. Clear golden with a majestic creamy tan head. Aromas of tropical hops, citrus, resin. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Dry, but not astringent. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Exquisite, rich hoppy and caramel flavors into a complex finish.

Bottle, 650ml. A semi-cloudy golden beer with a nice white head. Aroma is of floral hops and citrics, especially grapegruit. Taste is medium bitter and moderately sweet with fizzy carbonation and some astringency. Theres some malt character. Medium bodied with a nice hoppy and citric finish.
Bottle shared at Jasons. Hoppy citrus goodness.. Great nose. Some orange and fruit. Fantastic.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellowish orange with thick white head. Aroma is sweet fruity citrus. Taste is sweet malty hoppy with a orange grapefruit citrus hoppy finish. Very good.
Pretty fantastic IPA. Aroma is a bit less pronounced than expected, but the balance between pine citrus and caramel breadiness is spot on. Picked it up at the brewery with Jess in 2016.

2016 Boise stone fruit tasting on 8/27. Bottle share, thanks to Steve. Hefty golden orange body, small fluffy beige head. Aroma hints at whats to follow, piney hops and juicy citrus. Flavor follows on in spades, hoppy, dank, musty, piney. But in a good way...no, in a great way. Definitely worthy of its rep..

Bottle share, thanks to Steve. Pours a deep golden orange with a fluffy beige head. Nose is instantly hop filled citrus and tropical fruit, some pine dank hoppy goodness. Big hop flavors are bold and bitter, but drinkable. Citrus and pine are huge. This is great.

Sample @ Blåbær 16, from bottle. Light hazy golden pour with a generous head. Notes of tangerines, mangoes, grape fruit, citrus pee, crackers, some resiny bitterness, dank hops and some light herbal notes.

Intense tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, papaya, resin, pine. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Bitterness intensifies, more overripe tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, resin, pine, soft carbonation, medium bodied, bitter and dry finish. Beautiful IIPA, well-balanced, intense, but does it really live up to the hype? Keg at brewery taproom, Decorah, IA.

It pours golden yellow with a sudsy white head. The aroma has creamy malt, tropical malt, pineapple, pine and some citrus. It has a medium body with some lushness and semi sharp carbonation. The taste has tropical fruit, pine, grapefruit, toasted malt and no hint of alcohol. The finish is bold and well balanced. Thanks to gregwilsonstl for sharing this.

Wow. Beautiful dark gold. Fizzy. Thick white foam. Citrus.  Really good looking pour. Strong pine aroma....and pine flavor. Cracker dry. Pineapple (but not sweet)  This is a top 50 beer, that lives up to the hype.

Bottle courtesy of obsceneone. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is tangelo, kumquat, and huge citrus and tropical fruit. Flavor is similar with all manner of citrus -white grapefruit, kumquat, and tangelo. Medium in body and very nice overall.

Finally ticking this bish thanks to Al and Darrin :) Thanks guys! Bottle shared at the Blåbær Lambik 2016 release at Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is fruity as hell. Lots of tropical things like pineapples, mangos, melons going on. Also a lot of herbal spicy hops. Fresh citrus and tangerine. Taste is hoppy, tropical, dank, herbal, citrussy, melony. Delicious!

From bottle in blåbær line, thanks a bunch to Darrin. Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma has lots of fruity hops, melon, pineapple, citrus, spices. Taste is medium dry, light pale malty sweetness, lots of fresh hops, medium bitterness. Medium High carb and a light body for The abv. Good, but not as gold as expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy golden orange with a very tight foamy head. Aroma is tropical fruit, well citra.... Delicious and no signs of alcohol. Lots of single hop ipa out there but this is just very very good

Pours hazy apricot with a thick eggshell head. Aroma delivers strong resiny, woody hop and yeasty tones plus a snip of malt. Bold flavor features evergreen hops, fresh malt, citrus and yeasty tones. Mouthfeel offers firm fizz and body. Hail to the King!

Bottle dated 6/24/16. It pours a hazy pale orange color with a thick, creamy white head. The aroma has lots of juicy grapefruit, hints of pineapple and grass. Very soft pale maltiness in the background. Really nice juicy hop character. The flavor is the same with big grapefruit, pineapple and some hop spice in the finish, but the bitterness is low. Maybe a touch of hop related astringency on the palate, but overall its pretty creamy on the palate with mostly pale malt. No distracting caramel. A very good showcase of Citra. Worthy of the hype.
Bright yellow pour from 22oz bottle at home. White fluffy head. Juicy and pineapple grapefruit aroma. Taste is hoppy, vanilla, tropical and pine. Lemon. Super good.
From notes (6/6/15). This is a big, swirling citrus bomb with a really potent amount of juicy, Citra hop notes. One crazy good DIPA.
Amazing Citra hop aroma. The hop flavor was not as balanced as I would like.
Aroma is straight citrus. Lots of grapefruit aroma. Flavor is very grapefruit, almost a makes you pucker. Hides the Abv well and is not overly bitter. Great double IPA.

Poured from a bottle that was bottled less than two weeks ago. Its slightly hazy amber color with a thick one inch head. Very good retention. Aroma is citrus rind, apple juice. Floral notes are apparent. Newly mown lawn. Very resiny to the point of aggressiveness. A slight mango notes and sweet fruit notes in the back. Taste is very resiny with solid bready malt backbone. Its not too malty. Very floral and, again resiny. Very nicely balanced. Dry. Very easy on the tongue and the mouth. Soft carbonation and creamy.

Amazing IIPA.

Tasted from draft. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with white head. Aroma is citrus with some dank resin. Taste is extremely well balanced with nice malt backbone. Great citrus and melon fruity flavor. Just an awesome double IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a 22 ounce bomber, thanks to Ed. Big Citra character throughout, citrusy. There is a good malt backbone that makes this more interesting then a huge hop bomb.
March 5, 2016 - bottle shared by dogfish. Cloudy yellow pour with nice head. Very nicely balanced double ipa.

Un grand merci à Philippe pour le partage de cette bouteille! King Sue porte bien son nom (ou son rang) car cette bière est effectivement de classe impériale. Orangée, opaque et pleine de vie, il est difficile dimaginer une IIPA plus jolie que celle-là. Un véritable jus dorange gorgé de vitamine C. La mousse nest pas particulièrement épaisse mais dun blanc maculé, riche et interminablement persistant. Un profil aromatique basé sur lagrume, à la manière dune IIPA de la côte est. Une salade de fruits à la clémentine, la tangerine, lananas et jen passe tant il y en a. Un cocktail de houblon Citra aux parfums des plus exotiques. En bouche le liquide mapparaît plutôt west coast alors que la première gorgée me colle au palais. Les notes dammoniac, caractéristique que lon retrouve souvent chez le Citra, sont assez présentes ici mais clairement tempérées par ces fruits insistants. Lalcool se fait sentir mais lensemble est tellement punché et explosif quon ne note rien des défauts de cette bière. Un chef doeuvre dans le style!

Quite good. This ones brewed in Iowa not Florida which feels better. Solid iipa. Solid. Offers a gift of a good aroma, solid citrus hop taste with light bitterness. A joy to drink. Wickedly highly rated. Awesome beer but side by side with HALF ACRES DOUBLE DAISY CUTTER I think double daisy wins. And it's not even in the top 50 for iipa. So if it's good drink it. And this is good. So enjoy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

February 26, 2016. Bottle, shared by _angst_, thanks!

Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is very fruity with mango, pineapple, resin, hints of grapefruit, light pine notes.
Taste is medium sweet, very fruity, soft medium bitterness. Finish is fruity, sweet, soft balanced bitterness, pineapple, mango, slight pine and resinous notes. 

Medium bodied, soft carbonation, smooth slight cream texture. 


Two months, but holds up very well.

Bomber received in trade. Thank you Michael! Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head that leaves some sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity with crackers, white bread, caramel, grapefruit juice, pineapple, mango, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals, kumquats and lemon zest. Taste is sweet, bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent, very tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, pineapple, kumquats, apricots, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Great fruity IIPA. Most likely amazing fresh but even at this age, two months old, its great.
A: yellow/orange white head N: Loads of hops! Pine, pineapple, forest, citrus T: Pine, mango, strawberry O: Very nice hop taste, a bit sweetness.

An absolutely fantastic beer again from TG. Poured from bomber into Snifter. 

Pours a hazy orange with a solid white head with great lacing. 

Floral and fruity aroma. Awesome citra hop bomb.

Pours a cloudy orange-amber color with a solid, one finger broad head, which turns out to be utmost stable while revealing big, spongy bubbles.

Crisp citrus peel settles among flowery apple juice, together with white bread malts and a note of fresh cut grass. Has a mango ripeness to it, adding directly to the complexity of the citrus, while including soothing, flowery qualities among zingy kiwi. A resinous sweetness melts into the malts, creating a truly harmonious, yet aromaful nose.

Has a soft carbonation, present enough to provide a spritzy impact during the finish, which, apart from that, is completely soft on the tongue, producing a mellowing creaminess and an overall great mouthfeel. 

Tastes of a bowl of water, featuring fresh cut grass and a whole lot of juicy citrus and orange chunks. Due to the aqueous quality, fruits have a pleasant mildness to them, which vanishes, as the hops turn more powerful. Fruits turn crispier and a tad dryer then, while respecting the beers world class smoothness throughout, settling atop the rich creaminess. Reveals a fruit entangled malt sweetness after the swallow, slowly but steady transforming into a long lasting, citrus defined dryness. Even the bitter finish gets awesomely soothed by the outstanding mouthfeel, leaving the flavor focus on the fruits, while allowing subtle flavors to cut through during the late flavour transformation from malty to hoppy.

Flavourful and thrilling on the tongue, this one leaves me startled. It drinks like a dipa at the same time as it does not. First of all, the balance and mouthfeel in this are amazing, everything falls into place, citrus rages itself out on the palate leashed by smooth yeast, while no hint of alcohol becomes evident at all. Basically this drinks outstandingly easy. At the same time though, you can tell the intensity of flavors indicates a higher gravity, leading to a palate challenging complexity. Thats about it however, apart from that citrus unfolds playfully and most complex, remaining on the palate till the very end, providing even a certain freshness which lets you keep on drinking. Beautiful.

Bottle dated 12/22/2015. 
Aroma is very hop forward with a medium light cracker malt backbone. Notes of grapefruit pith, orange, pine resin, and lighter notes of tropical fruit and melon. 
Pours a hazy, golden orange with a medium large, thick white head that shows decent retention as it slowly, but steadily recedes to a thin film. Moderate lacing and medium sized legs. 
Flavor is moderately sweet with some cracker malt notes and a but of light caramel and honey. Medium strong bitterness with a hint of the alcohol. Moderate fruity hop notes with a lot of grapefruit pith and lighter orange and tropical fruit, especially mango. A medium light resinous and slightly soapy note. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very nice DIPA, but one that also doesnt quite live up to the TGB hype. Nice citra notes with a balanced, but light malt profile and body. Hops seemed a bit lacking in the flavor.

Tap at Blue Moon. Tropical melon, cantaloupe tones in the aroma. Fresher tasting than regular Sue, no green garlic/onion. Unfiltered orange-tan body. Drinks like a smooth bigger IPA, very easy going for a IIPA. Really pleasant on the palate. Great.

Very good example of a citra double IPA. That piney and fruit heavy aroma that has that orange/yellow hue. Tastes like a hop bomb in a good way that feels good on the palate. Overall, the beer should taste like you expect at 8.5%. Another great beer fro Toppling Goliath. Cheers!

A- pours a hazy fresh squeezed orange juice yellow. A mild egg shell white white thins quickly to a delicate skin. Good lacing. 

S- honey, citra hops, passion fruits and buttery croissant are pungent. Lemons, oranges, likes, grasses, caramel malts, earthy spices, coriander, cereal grains, and the faintest bit of sage make up a great aroma.

M- light to medium sticky body with a mild burn. Light carb.

T- great passion fruit juice, sweet malts to start. Lemons, orange pith, sage, pine resin, and honey in the middle. Dry herbal spiciness, tarragon. A faint cocoa. More zinc, lemons and loam in the end.

22 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy golden blonde with a small white head. Aroma reveals notes of piney hops, some dank notes, and biscuity zesty notes. Flavour is so dank and juicy, with loads of fresh meadows, dank hops, some floral notes, light citrus zest and a subtle crackery malt backbone. So well-constructed, with so many complementing flavours. Palate is dry and juicy. Pretty much everything I look for in a IIPA. Phenomenal.
Bottle - Sweet fruit tropical notes, touch of dank and grapefruit. Cloudy gold with a rich white head. So light and easy drinking, with a creamy light mouthfeel. So delicate and nice.

Howler. Aroma is ultra dank citra hops and strong caramel malt. Mango, pineapple, weed, pine, wood, caramel, and blood oranges. Tastes sweet and dank. Juicy pineapple, caramel apple, pine, weed, oranges, and herbs. Very little bitterness. Medium to full body. This is great but a little disappointing. Wish there was more bitterness to balance out the sweet and dank.

Bottle @ Aarons Wedding Eve Shindig. Thanks to either Andy or Mike. Hazed golden pour with white foam. Lots of grapefruit and orange to the beer. Some notes of sweet mango and apricot as well as a subtle tropical note. It does have a bit of sweetness, but not much in the way of bread or caramel. Lots of pineapple, citrus, and stone fruit on the tongue. A bitter finish and perhaps a touch of alcohol.

I imagine whoever it is who owns this brewery is an accomplished air guitarist who opened a brewery just so he could name it after his imaginary band, the logo of which he drew over and over in his junior high note book. This said, they do make good beer. This one is clear golden w/ a foamy head. It has great big old hop nose, herbal and citric w/ a touch of fresh pine needles. This is just a little sweet w/ a thick, rich hop character. Its full bodied with solid citrus rind bitterness in the finish. This is definitely a great showcase of the citra hop and I can solidly recommend it to any hop head on this here earth.

Great Taste of the Midwest, 2015. A dark yellow color, hazy and opaque, and lightly carbonated. Palate is heavy and full. Lots of hops and citrus, some malt, giving a little sweetness. I am pretty sure this is unfiltered and that is good. Full flavor, but the high abv is well hidden.
This shit is bomb...had at an ole MadCraftBeerWeek and most recently at GTMW15. Crazy hoppy orange juice...probably best dipa ive had...a desert island beer for sure.

On tap at Sanctuary, IC. Nice tropical aroma with some hints of scallions and lemongrass. Thin white head that laces mediocre. Very murky orange hue. Haze is slightly ok but I think this is a bit much. Taste is juicy pineapple and subtle hints of onion which I like. Overall a good beer with flavor and aromatics. Visual appearance and mouthfeel are not quite right.

Bottle [from trade with mista, huge thanks!] @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Hazy yellow to light orange color, medium sized white to off-white head. Aroma is malts, hops, grapefruit. Taste malts, hops, grapefruit, slightly tropical fruits in the background, perfect bitterness. A great mix between fruit hops and bitter hops. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle @ benzai. Hazy orange colour with a creamy, medium sized white head. Smells hops, all kinds of fruit, very fresh, slightly chives/onion (which I like). Tastes hops, fruity, fresh, quite bitter, tropical fruits. Full body, nice carbo.
22oz bottle pours a hazy bright yellow amber without a bit of head. Smooth tropical and citrusy hops. Some marmalade and a little resiny.
Draft at Bricks. Pours hazy orange with nice white head and lacing. Nose is pineapple, mango. Taste is sweet with some dryness and bitterness in the aftertaste. Great!

From bottle. Lightly hazed gold with a white head. Hoppy aroma impression is lemon, lemongrass, botrytis, green onion, pineapple juice, Bartlett pear. Medium-full bodied, sweet, bitter, a little green banana and green papaya. Little to no malt expression, its sweet and sugary, but the texture is nicely filling.

Draft at Dexters pre GTMW event, courtesy of Dan the AP Chemistry teacher. Many thanks, and good luck with your imminent first born! Cloudy golden amber color. Huge pineapple and grapefruit aroma. Taste is pseudoSie on steroids. Delicious.
Bright tangerine nose that is absolutely superb. Citra bomb, lots of fruitiness, strong mandarin orange.

Bottle... Pours mostly clear and yellow with a small, wispy, white head. Decent retention. Fruity and musky hops dominate the aroma, followed by tropical fruits, melons and a lesser note of funky armpit. Light-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and airy carbonation. The flavor is mostly bitter, featuring rindy hops and pale malts, followed by a lengthy, raspy, tongue-numbing finish. Bottle courtesy of 50belair!

21/VI/15 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ ElMananas Massaman Curry Tasting - BB: n/a, bottled: V/12/15 (2015-799)  Thanks to ElManana + 1 for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy bright orange beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, mango, pineapple, sweet, peaches, very fruity. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very fruity, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, bit piny, resinous. Aftertaste: dry, bitter hops, citrus, some grapefruit, little sweet, hoppy, resinous, mango, passion fruits.

22 oz bomber from Al Carpenter. You son of a bitch! Shared with ebone1988. The pour is a nice foggy golden orange with a thick fluffy pure white head and fantastic lacing. The aroma is insane. Bursting citrus, insane pine notes, great hoppy bitterness. This should be an event. The flavor is amazing. So juicy and sweet before the pineapple and tropical fruits come in with a strong pineyness and light resin. The hops are present, but mellow. The mouth feel is incredible. Thick and creamy, but it disappears quickly, keeping the crisp cleanness with it. The aftertaste is piney tropical fruits with a hint of malt. Absolutely amazing IIPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is sweet tropical fruit, pine, wonderful. Appearance is great, golden amber with a white head. Taste is unbelievable. Juicy tropical fruit eases into pine and malt, perfectly balanced without a hint of alcohol. Mouthfeel is divine, perfect carbonation, soft yet crisp. Overall, I knew from pseudoSue that this would be phenomenal...I was not disappointed. This is the best IPA out there.

Bottle acquired via trade with ReeceG! Golden tangerine pour with a tightly packed ivory cap that left significant spattering of lacing inside the glass. Orange rind, mango, papaya, honey-baked biscuit, and lemongrass. Floral, bright, and balanced. Delicious!

Bomber from a trade shared with Eric Teusink. Really tasty. Great fruit and chewy orange citrus. Nice aroma with lots of orange citrus. A bigger malt body and presence with a faint caramel sweetness. Top notch.

On tap at Hunahpus Day. Served in a taster. Pale orange yellow. Big white head. A little hazy. Great retention. Big citrus aroma. Has some grassiness, too. Cracker malt and doughy sweetness. Taste is similar. Orange citrus hops. Light pale malt sweetness. Cracker malt. Slightly grassy bitterness in the back. Medium body. Just the right amount of sweetness. Tastes just like an imperial Sue should taste. Outrageous.

Clear golden colour, white head. Fruity aroma, pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, topical fruits, bit of onion, citra. Bitter flavour, hops, tropical fruits, apricot, light coconut. Finish lingering tropical fruits, mango, citra, passion fruit. Brilliant. Lots of room for the citra to shine. Heres to number 1000, Bjorn!
(From 66cL bottle @ ElMananas Massaman Chili tasting, Gent. Thanks for sharing, Bjorn!)
Bottle at Massaman Tasting. Thanks to a BA-trade. Crazy excited to try this one. Aroma of exotic fruits, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, just mentioning exotic fruits now. Amazing beer. Great!

Bottle shared by my friend Eric at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours cloudy golden with a thick off-white head and a citrus aroma. There is a full-bodied caramel malt flavor with lots of hop bitterness annd a strong citrus finish.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2015 Cloudy, non-transparent body. Smooth and super-citrusy, with lots of grapefruit and nectarine fruit showing. Decidedly tropical in terms of its citrus appeal, ultra-hoppy, with a spicy hop backbone that lingers for minutes.
Hazy yellowish amber pour with a white head. Massive citra hop nose. Big clean citrus hop taste. Lingering bitterness and some heat.

Bottle at home, a gift from girlfriends family. Thanks. Pours a hazy orange copper color with a bubbly white head that fades to a thick lace. Aroma is piney, tropical fruit, faintly sweet. Screams hops. Taste is light pine, juicy citrus and some tropical fruit. Faint honey sweetness. A bit of cracker. Smooth bitterness lingers on the palate. Leaves a nice lace on the glass. Medium body, high carbonation. A bit oily. Very good beer. Enjoyed fresh, only 2 weeks old. Balanced and highly enjoyable. Mmm.

Pour is completely hazed deep amber with about 1 inch of tight white head and a decent lacing. Nose is very hoppy, tons of citra, very melon rind and musky, gets a touch boozy and a little green. Flavor is similar, below the quality of pseudo sue, citra blast, musky rind, gets boozy mid to late palate and bitterness and acidity are a touch high. Body gets a touch syrupy and messy, lighter carb. Falls a bit short of the masterpiece that is pseudo sue

(22oz bomber) cloudy medium yellow, soapy bubbles. Nose of light onion, citrus fruits, unique yeast characteristic, dry and not super malty, lemon/lime zest, orange citrus pulp, Taste is dry and citrusy, quite yeasty, dry, touch of umami, grapefruit oil without being overly bitter, other citrus zest. The finish is oily but dry in sweetness. Nice texture to the beer. Linger of slight umami.

22oz bottle thanks to Darrel. Pours out hazy golden topped with a small white head. Nose is tons of tropical fruit citrus pineapple melon and caramel sweetness. Taste is more of the heavy tropical fruit citrus pineapple mango caramel sweetness and a nice bitterness on the end. I hate to like this brewery but they are doing some great stuff.

Bomber thanks to Shane. Bottled a week or so ago. Poured a cloudy apricot color with a thick white head. Nose is dank hops and bready malts. Taste is tropical fruits with a pineapple striking a big note with me. Really enjoyed this one.

Poured from a bomber into a snifter--phenom bottle trade a golden yellow with a white head.
Aroma is juicy bitter oranges.
Flavor BLEW ME AWAY!!!! DIPA is my preferred style and had my fair share. This one is exceptional. Really worth the hype. 
Luscious to the palate and am blessed to have traded for 2 of these beauties.

22oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. Bottled last week. 

Pours cloudy orange-copper. Off white head with nice lacing. 

Aroma is heavily tropical. Pineapple, Mango, citrus. Fairly "dank". Some malty back notes. 

Taste is pretty well balanced. Bitter, but sweetness too. Good flavor. 

Body is medium. softer carbonation. Longer finish. 

Really nice stuff. Had this next to trillium dry hopped fort point, and I dont know which I like more.

22 oz. bottle sample from a friend in a King Sue glass picked up by the same friend from notes. Pours a hazy orange/dark golden color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have big citrus and tropical fruit hops, earthy and oniony on the flavor, some resin, toasted bread, some floral notes as well, good, flavorful DIPA that I am glad I got to try.

Yes my forum friends have had some Iowa brews. This IPA is superb. Real pine and floral nose. It may have elder ado or not but smells of that varity. Real rose and sweet pine. Great alcohol balance with blend of hops and malts perfect.

Pours a hazy orange color, fluffy white head that breaks into spotty lacing. Looks like juice in a glass. Aromas are loaded with tropical aromas of pineapple, mango, peach along with some citrus notes or orange and lemon. Just a hint of alcohol in the nose. Taste is not as vibrant as I was hoping. An initial burst of mango/peach is quickly surpassed by a medium-heavy bitterness of sharp acidic citrus. Hints of alcohol permeate through a bit in the back end. Certainly a nice DIPA, but I much, much prefer regular pseudoSue over this bigger version. Not as much balance or flavor here, but still better than most DIPAs.

Poured from bomber into tulip. Unusual very pale orange, cloudy color. Medium lingering head. Good aroma filled with tropical fruit. Excellent flavor with a nice balance between hops and malt. No hop bomb here. Very light drinking with a soft and supple mouthfeel. This wasnt aggressive in the slightest. Beautiful smooth and nimble.

Holy hell, what a nose. Bomber to snifter. Nose is an overpowering citrus, tropical, fruity explosion. Just wonderful. I think this is my first 10/10 on aroma. Pour is a very hazy orange with medium white head, mostly tiny bubbles. laces well. Taste is very mango, tropical, kiwi, but short of apricot or peach. The hop flavor seems to add a subtle sweet like mouthfeel, almost like vanilla if that even makes sense. Holy hell. Seems to dull out as it sits and finished with a bit of alcohol warming that is almost hot, like a fusel alcohol. Oranges come out in the aroma and flavor as it warms. overall a wonderfull hop expression with a balanced but not cloying or sweet malt backbone. If the alcohol were better hidden then this would likely be my highest rated bier. Thanks kevin

Bottle: Thanks, Doug. Cloudy, opaque golden & orange tinted body with a foamy, soft white head. Lightly creamy, slow to settle to a chunky collar with moderate, sheety lacing. Aroma explodes with pineapple, mango, grapefruit, tangerine, wet grass, mild pine, resin, hints of green onion, light perfume, candied citrus peel... Citra hops going to work on my nostrils. Taste is... WOW. Somehow even better than the aroma. Juicy, candied oranges, grapefruit, citrus, pineapple, magno, papaya... Both citric & tropical with a strong underbody of pine, grass, resin, & light hop oils. Lightly sweet sugar cookie & cracker malt adds oomph to the hops without stealing the spotlight. Juicy, fruity, citrusy finish with bitter pine & hints of white pepper fading out. This is an absolutely incredible double IPA. Upper echelon.

Bottle from the brewery shared by RussianDragon. Many thanks. This was one of my top wants.

The beer is yellow and moderately hazy with a white cap. Like Sosus, huge tropical fruit notes. Wonderfully fresh and über hoppy with a subtle, bready malt character in support. Medium bitterness, finishing clean with lingering juicy hop tones. It has been fun to watch the IPA / DIPA style evolve over the last several years. King Sue is without question a world class beer, on par with my favorites from Alpine, Hill Farmstead and the like.
Very nice pineapple smell. Light foam in mouthfeel. Heavy hops taste that was too much for me.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Pours cloudy and bright orange/yellow. Almost looks like orange juice. Aroma is bursting with citrus and tropical fruits and is typical TG. Taste is absolutely amazing and juicy. Full of orange, peach, mango, and pineapple. Been wanting to try this for a while and ReeceG came through for me. Absolutely superb.

22 oz. bottle from the calming shores of Iowa. Pours a hazed, pale orange-gold with a small white head that laces the glass. Not quite as murky as some TG offerings, but almost all of their stuff is incredibly cloudy. Aroma of tropical and citrus fruits, herbs, onion (another common TG characteristic, which seems odd for a Citra beer), sweet and pale malts, hay, and florals. Flavor of citrus peel, sweet and pale malts, pineapple, pine resin, florals, and tropical fruit rind. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a juicy, resinous mouthfeel. Smooth and balanced, more so than other hoppy TG stuff. But didnt quite pop for me the same way some of those did - despite being completely excellent in its own right.

22oz bottle. Big thanks to phaleslu for sharing. Totally hazy kind of golden orange color. Thin off-white head. Leaves good lace. Awesome big perfumey hoppy floral nose, kind of spicy, piney. Moderate bitter taste, kind of zesty, light to moderate sweet. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Alcohol is very well-hidden. Great DIPA.

Bottle. The pour is murky orange, very hazy, interesting pour. The aroma is a hop delight, so much citrus. The taste is awesome. Just a perfect brew of hops, so smooth. Lives up to the hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2015 Fresh bottle in trade from Joe basically as an extra. Huge thanks. Pours super murky yellow colored with a big fluffy white head. Really ugly to be honest. Aroma of sweet hop nectar, pineapples, pine needles, dank mustiness. Flavor is lots and lots of sweet pineapples balanced alongside huge bitter pine. Pretty chewey and dry, medium plus carbonation, crisp refreshing finish. Really nice DIPA on the bitter end of the spectrum. Quite the hype monster, and this is excellent but doesnt live up to that. Doesnt hold a candle to Pseudo for me, which is saying something because this is very good. Definitely worth getting but dont bend over backward for it. Deserves a score a little higher but got knocked down due to the ugly look.

Bottle at Corkscrews, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks man! Pour is super hazy orange with a big white head and great lacing. Big peachy, orange peels, some biscuit, grassy, somewhat earthy, lemony, and lemons in the aroma. Taste is juicy stone fruits, oranges, grapefruits, lemons, straw, some spicy hops, and mango with a fairly bitter finish. Full mouthfeel with high carbonation. Solid DIPA.

Bottle with Stephen. Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with an off white head. Peach, mango, herbal, lightly piney, tropical fruity aroma. Juicy tropical fruity flavor with bubblegum, mango, pineapple. Very dry and juicy. Nice.

On Draught, 
I guess entering this rating slipped my mind but I had it on draught about 2 or 3 weeks ago.

The beer pours a very pale golden color, very hazy with a smallish head and some lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is a bunch of fresh hoppiness, orange and citrus rind, melon and a bit of dankness. Add to that a little touch of alcohol. 

The flavor is much like the aroma, citrus rind, orange, some white grape... but all this is hop driven. Its bright and juicy, its low on bitterness but has enough bitterness for balance. Its got a touch more alcohol presence than I would prefer, but beyond that its great. 

The truth is that I cant distinguish much difference from Pseudo Sue, which in and of its self is a compliment, as Sue is a fantastic beer. Although I prefer Pseudo Sue due to there being less alcohol presence, which is something I prefer to avoid in hoppy beers. This beer is wonderful, Im just not sure I could be bothered to get psyched up about seeking it out when I could just drink Sue on draught.
Golden orange with a nice haze. Thick mouthfeel filled with juicy orange and grapefruit pith. Slightly bitter, very juicy mild sweetness with tons of citra

Bottle. Pours murky and hazy golden with medium white head. Nice look to her. aromas are pine, orange dankery, mineral water, and skunk. Flavor is most of the same with slightly boozy orange, and grapefruit hop notes, cheese, and light caramel malt. As good as any double IPA out but still gravitating towards singles, sessions, and hoppy pales these days.
22 ounce bottle. Thanks Dustin! Pours a cloudy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, and grass. Taste is pine, grapefruit, tropical, grass, and malt. Excellent.
Bottle thanks to Jimmie. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, caramel malt, tropical fruit, orange peel. Very juicy. Medium body.
Bottle pours hazy yellow with big head. Aroma is big citra fruity hops, taste is very well balanced bitter and smooth finish
Bottle thanks Jimmie. Hazy golden pour with white cloudy head. Fruit citrus, huge orange and grassy aromas. Really enjoyed the juicy citrus as tropical, grassy hop flavors.

A - Pours hazy golden orange with a nice one finger tall white head, slowly dissipating down to a light film, leaving sticky webs of lace on the glass.


S - Smells of intense pine resin, tropical fruits, wet grass, more pine needles and a bit of doughy pale malt.


T - Starts off with lots of pine and tropical fruit - mainly grapefruit and mango - quickly being joined by the fresh cut grass and some chewy pale malt. Finish is quite bitter, lingering long after the finish.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Smooth, bitter feel from start to finish. Tons of bitterness to go around.


O - Hard to say this lived up to the "hype" even tho it was an excellent DIPA. I cant wait to visit these guys next year.

22 oz. bottle, gigantic thanks to Nitze for sharing this!! Extremely turbid fuzzy peach colored pour, outstanding lacing. Nose and flavor are really nice, with beautiful candied lemon, pithy white grapefruit, dry lemongrass, hints of loam and earthen hop. Clean and aggressively lean on the palate; drinks extraordinarily for the ABV. Really great, but I think PseudoSue is the better beer. Still, gorgeous.

Bottle thanks to Minh. Pours a hazy orange with large frothy white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is huge pine, juicy fruit, resin, hemp. Medium mouthfeel with a nice citrus, resin, light bitterness, easy to drink, really enjoyed this one.

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Big thanks. Poured a murky light amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is nettle hop, yeast, light caramel. The flavour is medium bitter with a big woody, resin, grass, nettle hop palate. Medium bodied

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy golden orange with an off white head. Aroma of big citrus, tropical fruit, orange peel, resinous hops and a light caramel malt. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Gives that wonderful feeling of hops coming out of every pore. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis & JMGreenUK
Lovely citrus aroma. Thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely citrus bitterness. Great,
Drank fresh at DLD. I want back twice, amazing dipa, thats super easy to drink.

Bomber, huge thanks to zach. Lots of tropical fruit on the aroma. Taste has starts with some big grapefruit and pineapple but then finishes rather weak. Not much aftertaste. Very low bitterness. Its pretty good, but I dont think it compares to most of the Vermont stuff.

Bottle - Pours an opaque color of orange juice with a thick white head lots of lacing. Total citrus aroma. At first taste theres a bitterness with a citrusy tint, maybe a touch of resin. I had to wait 1hr in line for this bottle and I would do it again if the opportunity comes.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 On tap at Toppling Goliath. Pours an opaque golden peach color, similar to the appearance of orange and grapefruit juice. Light only barely passes on the rim when backlit. Ozzys Crazy Train in the background, how fitting. Thick soapy white head fades to edge and leaves thick sticky lacing. Aroma is an aggressive blast of citrus, namely Citra hops. This beer is already King. Mild tropical fruit, but mainly orange juice bitterness and tang. Big malt presence also, but hops are the name of the game here. Flavor is bold and intense. Big hops and tropical fruit - pineapple and banana, etc. Words arent really adequate, theres a lot going on here. Alcohol is completely masked, and the impression that its closer to 10% than 8.5%. Outstanding.

Tap. Nice aroma and a bit amped over psuedosue, but had a cloudy pour and not enough punch in my opinion.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Hunahpus Day 2014 served in souvenir taster. Hazy yellow-orange body with a very tall white head. I got the very last pour, so it was coming out of a pitcher that was used to let the foam settle after the keg kicked. Lots of lacing and a persistent head. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruits, grass, and some bready malts once you cut through the Citra onslaught. Taste is a light citrus/tropical sweetness initially followed by moderate grass and citrus peel bitterness on the finish. Medium body, very creamy texture (thought this might have been because the keg kicked, but others seem to agree), average to soft carbonation, dry finish with a nice lingering bitterness.

2nd May 2014CBC Session 1. Growler share, big thanks to Krjukoff. Hazy pale gold beer, big bubbly white head. Palate is light and dry with very modest carbonation. Floral yeasty.sweetness. Whisper of something fruity. Dry finish. Profoundly disappointing.
Juicy, fruity, strong, bold, tropical, orange, grapefruit, mango...very fruity. Very strong taste yet very smooth.

Draft. Pulpy looking OJ body. Smaller soapy white head. Bigger medium body. Pulpy fruity. Full of meaty fruit. Juicy and pulpy. Tropical. Orange. Grapefruit. Mango. Such drinkability. Great flow. Wow. "Fresh squeezed" Besides the original Sue, nothing else like it.

On tap, pours a very murky orange with a thick white head, holy crap, this thing smells amazing, tons of tropical fruit and citrus all over the place, could probably smell it from 10 ft away, the flavor is pretty much what you would expect after smelling it, tons of citrus and fruit with a smooth finish, love that the abv is turned down some so I could enjoy a few, dang good.

180cl (64oz) growler, fresh batch, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Hans for sharing!, very complex bitter brew, fruity/woody and slightly floral/sweet, very balanced, cloudy, rocky head, top class!, Probably one of the best IPAs I tasted till now!

On tap at the craftsman table and tap. Hazy yellow and awesome. Huge mango aroma and sweet tropical taste. Medium body, smooth and very drinkable. So juicy and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Session 1. Thanks, oh generous RBian! Pours mostly clear, yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Solid DIPA, nice and juicy, lots of citrus, grapefruit in particular. Moderate pith. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Dry and lightly pithy to finish with mild warmth, low bitterness, lots of citrus juices, notable pale malt sweetness. Very good DIPA. Best on RB? Of course not.

Growler - pours a murky orange w/ white frothy head. The nose is very citrusy - oranges, tangerines, lemons, and limes. Very much the same in the taste plus some hoppy bitterness. This beer is awesome!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Huge thnx to geoffrey for this one ! 
Pours fuzzy yellow , good whitr steady fluffy head 
Very fruity and intense smell 
Perfect carbo . 
Intense fruity taste . Like pseudo sue , but more balanced ( sounds weird hah ? ) 
Hoppy taste , yet barely noticable bitterness , it is damn damn good , yet very different than other IIPA / DIPA s . Way less bitter , and more fruityness . Another great one from TG ! 

Re-rate from bottle , ca 1 month ( ? ) old . 
Just as I remember, only it amazed me again , so moved up the score from 4,7 to 4,8

Growler brought to CBC 2014, huge thanks to tkrjukoff! Hazy pale golden with a nice white head. Lovely fresh hop aroma, citrus, hay, mango, pine apples, peach, some passion fruit. Hoppy pine apple flavor, peach, passion fruit, biscuit notes, citrus, caramel, some mango. Very nice refreshing beer with a distinct hoppy fruity finish.
Huge fan of Toppling Goliath before, but King Sue has rocked my world. Great cloudy pour - looks like orange juice at first glass. My favorite double IPA yet & itll be tough to beat!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 On tap at Coopers Tavern in Madison. Looks like a pint of OJ. Fresh pineapple fruity smell. Tastes so awesome. Lots of fresh mango grapefruit. Made me smile instantly upon tasting. Delicious! -- 2nd rating: first bottling of it. Still as good as ever. Bumping it up to a 5 rating because I cant stop smiling.  This beer makes me so happy.
Fruity sweet and bitter smell and taste. Golden yellow look, just like pineapple juice. Perfect warmup in line for CBC.

Growler huge tnx to Derrick. Pours murky orange golden with a good beigish lacing head. Aroma is slap on your face tropical pineapples mango passion fruits piny citric. Flavor clean fruity as aroma nicely bitter not up front but well hidden behind leaving good space for the hops. Half Growler left :).
On tap at DLD. Pours ver hazy orange with thin head. More citrusy aroma then resin. Light carb med bod. Nice taste but bitters in the end.

Draft pour at some weird beer festival. Poured big and gold, eggshell head. Big tropical fruit nose, a nice blast of hops though not super over the top. Pretty sweet, but quite bitter. Oily, bigger body, nice bitter finish. A very nice DIPA, I would definitely like to try this one again. Didnt shatter my earth, but thats just fine with me.

This one poured a beautifully enticing hazy golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of tons of citra hops, very tropical, mangos, stone fruit, pineapple, dont think ipa aroma gets any better. Flavor was just the same only a little less. Not much bitterness, but some for balance just bratiful citra, no sweetness at all, but soft too. Loving these guys right now

On tap at DLlD 2014 (Munster, IN). Pours a murky golden amber hue, well hazed with frothy offwhite head atop. Good ring and stick around. Aromas show a potent floral and dank hop aroma, touches of fruit and citrus, grapefruit, touches of bread and resiny hops. Initial is a bit bready, firm fruity citrus and tropical hops, florals and bitter dryness. Some nice hop character shows some gentle sweetness, light earth, nice fruit but quite dry and bitter. Middle is dry, fruity and bitter. Tropical fruit, mango and citrus meet some florals, touches of bread, more fruit character. Backend is dry, bitter, gentle resin, faint pizza spice. Dry and bitter backend, gentle melon, citrus and tropical fruit. Some firm bitterness, nice hop character. Tasty shit. They get these bad boys pouring right and theyll be the best of the best.

Cloudy orange body with large white head and soapy lacing. Intense citrus, grapefruit, dank juicy tropical notes, mango, pineapple, and pine. Medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and lively bitterness with just the slightest bit of sweetness. Very nice use of Citra.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2015 What a freaking amazing double IPA. On tap at DLD. This was my favorite drink of the day. The pour was a cloudy orange with a white head.Huge citrus, grapefruit, pinapple, mango aroma. The taste is just the right amount of bitter and the alcohol isnt so high that it shines through at all. Perfectly balanced everything.
650ml bottle. REally nice dipa, tropical notes about, a tad sweet, good stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Tap at Sloopys in La Crosse, WI. Pours a cloudy orange with a medium white head and nice lacing. Aromas of, citrus, herbs, glorious Citra. Flavor is pure awesome. Get some I?d you can.

Well, it had to happen sometime - my first perfect 5 beer. This one is phenomenal. Ran over to the Nova from Mpls to try this one on tap in a snifter. 2 - 12ounce pours. Visually this is a knock out for me. Opaque creamy golden color with moderate low amount of bright white thick foam. Aromas of citra goodness, slightly subdued. Taste is a phenomenally strong amount of citrus and dank. Palate is creamy. Really is the best beer Ive ever had.

Tap at TG, i cant believe it lasted! Pours completely cloudy orange, small creamy off white head, great lacing. Aroma is a wonderful mix of grapefruit, dank, musty, passion fruit, a bit of sweat, cat piss. Flavor is fruity and juicy, light sweet and light bitter, not harsh at all, dank lovely citra at its best. Medium plus body, creamy, rich, almost milky mouthfeel. This stuff is God nectar. Cant wait until it is bottled.
Draft. Golden, frothy white head, nice lacing. Nose is bit citra hops, tropical fruits. Taste is big citra hops, mango, pineapple. Sticky mouthfeel.

Draught at EBF on 3/22/14Toppling Goliaths beers all were in great shape and all poured bright with strong heads atop them; this one being no exception. Copper-amber body with a white head.Extraordinary amount of hops in the nose and mostly tropical fruitiness resulting. Some light touches of pine on the end but its somewhat passing. Reminds me a lot of Pliny the Elder, though with less citrus than that one, but the lightly sweet sugars are there. Very powerful.Sweet, not horribly so, but probably a bit more than it needs to be. Though it certainly does have a lot of hops to balance here. Pineapple, mango, kiwi, wintergreen and plenty pale malt sugars. Great carbonation levels leading to a creamy body. Light touches of syrup here and there and with some definite alcohol warmth. An awesome double IPA, for sure, but a little more lightness would be appreciated; this stuff is very, very big and over-the-top.
Wow. This beer is amazing. Dank? yeah. Bitter? Somewhat. Juicy? Yes. Tropical fruits everywhere? YES! Wow, balanced, bold, delicate, gigantic hop profile. WOW.

Échantillonné du Extreme beer fest 2014: Tout comme la Sosus, le nez est absolument abrutissant de fruits mûrs et juteux. En bouche cest sur la fine ligne du juteux/résineux/souple qui en fait un liquide presque infaillible. Buvabilité brutale.

sample at extreme beer fest, yea this is completely incredible, bold strong and complex and nuanced all at once. Tons of pinapple, mago, pine, sweet, malts. soft carb, fruity bitter finish, THIS IS AMAZING.
Pours a pale yellow. Aroma is citra forward with notes of orange and grapefruit. Moderate bitterness
Possibly the best DIPA ive ever had. Huge tropical fruits, dank resin, a touch of scallion, and citrus. Medium sweet to balance the huge juicy hops. So delicious need more now.
on tap at huna day. pours a bright orange with an off white head. big juicy tropical fruit and hop taste. great beer wish I couldve had more but there was a 30 min line per pour.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 Murky soap water. Aroma is very fruity - lots of citra here. Smells sweet! Taste is syrupy sweet tropicals with a bitter finish. Almost feels like a barley wine with the consistency of the beer. Finish is sticky. Overall, not my sort of double IPA but definitely appreciate whats going on.

Bottle shared by Clark at Pegs. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Fruity hop aromas. Tropical fruit hop notes dominate the show. Just enough smooth caramel malt undercurrents to keep her nicely balanced. Fantastic body and mouthfeel. An outstanding DIPA....

Tap at Shorts. Should preface this rating by saying that Im a Citra hop fan boy. Pour is really cloudy yellow with a small ring of bubbles. Looks like a really filthy hefe. Aroma is an explosion of Citra hop. Tons of grapefruit, Mandarin orange, pineapple, and faint pine. Pretty much what I like in an IPA Aroma. Flavor is sweet malt up front followed by an explosion of citrus. Like eating pineapple and mandarin oranges. Faint piny hop bite at the end. Juicy. Creamy with light effervescence. Over the top but great. Pretty well balanced as well. Maybe the best smelling IPA I have ever had.

Growler filled 2/22/2014 and enjoyed 3/1/2014. Poured into a Toppling Goliath snifter. 

Pours a completely opaque bright yellow orange, with two fingers of frothy, foamy stark white head. Excellent sticky lacing throughout. I simply cannot get over the sheer brilliance of the body on this... look like orange juice. Smell is bright citra hops full of grapefruit, tangerine, and clementines, with a touch of dank fresh hop and some characteristic peppercorn. Has an earthiness to it which I have never encountered in citra before, expect a touch in Hill Farmstead Double Citra, and Im loving it. The taste is... stunning. Unbelievably juicy and fresh, bursting with fresh squeeze orange juice, tangerines, and melon. There is honestly no malt profile to speak of. Body is incredibly juicy and refreshing, with the malt providing a fluffy backbone for the citra to thrive, but not contributing any real flavors. No trace of alcohol.

Quite simply, this is best double IPA Ive ever had. Please make this again Toppling Goliath.

Pours  orange like an orange julius. Wat? Aroma is full on tropical fruit and skunky weed. Pine tar is hanging out in the background, not overwhelming. Minimal malt profile going on. Medium bitterness, plenty dry but with a nice body to it. Just a big juicy brew, plenty tame. Would repete.

Aroma: big citrus presence, lots of grapefruit, fresh floral and grassy notes, melon and some tangerine, also a bit of pine/resin. Notes of crackers and yeast, mostly hop focused though.
Appearance: very cloudy, milkshake like, white head with average retention and leaves spotty lacing.
Taste: big citrus and tropical fruit blast, orange, melon, also some mango. Bitterness is medium-high but not overwhelming or astringent. Crackers and bread dough with a bit of sweetness help to balance the bitterness but largely stay out of the way of the fresh hop flavors. Finish has a touch of sweetness, no lingering bitterness. Really fresh and fantastic, alcohol is well hidden. 
Palate: medium body and carbonation, very smooth, finishes clean.
Overall: great IPA, really enjoyed this.

Cloudy straw with very small white head. Citra aroma is huge. Fruity with strong resinous pine. Taste is full of citrus fruits with some tropical notes. Finishes with a bit of the pine the nose had. Medium heavy body. Great stuff.
Pretty milky in appearance. Familiar citra hop aromas and flavors just a bit boozier than PseudoSue
